lead_paragraph: In a new effort to counter the lure of terrorism, a former American jihadist is moving into the public sphere to research the ideology he once spread.

headline.print_headline: A Onetime Qaeda Recruiter Turns His Voice Against Jihad
headline.main: Once a Qaeda Recruiter, Now a Voice Against Jihad

snippet: In a new effort to counter the lure of terrorism, a former American jihadist is moving into the public sphere to research the ideology he once spread....
abstract: Former Al Qaeda recruiter Jesse Morton now focuses on countering damage caused by his recruits, many of whom are still at large, as research fellow at George Washington University’s Program on Extremism; served as informant for Federal Bureau Investigation after his deradicalization, which reduced his 11-year prison sentence to three years and nine months.
